column4: dutch? whats it with dutch moving to australia? I've been hearing that a lot lately
you just shouldnt live in the cities, move to the countryside. we did that a year ago and it's great here. living in a small village near Amersfoort
Ha. Where in holland can I drive for 2 hours and be somewhere without _any_ people (and still in holland?)
Um, I've lived in a small town in de achterhoek for most of my life.
I just need to take my bike for 20 minutes and I'm in the middle of the forest near Zeist, which is beautiful and silent :)
ok, thats barren countryside as well :-D
far more barren then where you are, but still full!
ah well, I guess I'm just lucky at where I live. it's nice and peaceful here
Just can't get away from people in holland. even if you find somewhere quiet, chances are someone else will also wander past within 30 mins.
Drove my wife mental when we lived there :-)
depends on the weather I guess. I walked around in the forest near Zeist two weeks ago with average weather and walked around for over an hour, not encountering anyone
I've been in proper deseret outback now - *that* is proper silence.
yeah, politics has gone a little bit fascist here recently.
But they'll probably let you migrate if you're white and educated.
it's only 4 hours away and nice & cheap ;-)
